wikipedia_page.main: Richard Worthington Smithells  (12 July 1924 – 13 June 2002) was a British paediatrician and Emeritus professor of paediatrics at the University of Leeds. Smithells was most notable for research into neural tube defects, congenital abnormality registers, genetic counselling, and rubella in pregnancy and for later suggesting direct examination of the foetus by photography using ultrasonography.

response: *Richard Smithells, 77, British paediatrician and Emeritus professor
